meanings.definition: The process or technique of photographing objects at a greatly reduced size.
meanings.sent1: Microphotography allows us to capture tiny details that are not visible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent2: She studied microphotography to learn how to take pictures of small insects.
meanings.sent3: The detective used microphotography to find hidden clues in the miniature painting.
meanings.sent4: In the world of microphotography, even a grain of sand can look like a majestic mountain.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of microphotography lies in revealing the hidden world of the minuscule.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a collection of microphotography showcasing intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: He marveled at the clarity of the microphotography capturing the texture of a leaf.
meanings.sent3: The artist used microphotography to create a series of unique and fascinating images.
meanings.sent4: Her room was adorned with colorful microphotography capturing the essence of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The magazine featured stunning microphotography of everyday objects transformed into art.
